resources.string: These instruments can\'t work for the module
.\nI loaded the correct screen for you ;-)
Your Cockpit++.lua is not up do date, please download and install the last version of the Cockpit++.lua
Your Cockpit++ application is not up do date, please install the new version
To enjoy the new features, you need to download and install into the scripts folder the new Cockpit++.lua file\n\nMore information in the \"Install guide\"
How to make DCS communicating with the app?
To communicate by wifi, your Android and your DCS must know the IP address of each other, you will find here the steps to configure everything
from here: https://github.com/CockpitPP/CockpitPP_lua/archive/master.zip (link also available in the app\'s description on the Playstore, type \"Cockpit DCS astazou\" in the PlayStore)
2) Go in C:\\Users\\yourUser\\Saved Games\\DCS\\Scripts folder (create if not exist)
3) Open the export.lua file (create it if not exist) and add the line:
if you don\'t know how to create the Export.lua file, you can take the one you downloaded with Cockpit++.lua
4) In the same folder, add the file Cockpit++.lua\nNow you should have this:

5) Open the Cockpit++.lua and add the IP address of your Android phone (You will find the Android IP in the Cockpit++ application, in "settings", you must be connected by wifi on the same network than your computer)
For example, if you Android IP is 192.168.0.12, you must write:
Of course you can use several Android devices in the same time, just add other Android IP if you want to use Cockpit++ with more than 1 device:

6) In the app, go to Settings, add your computer's IP 
You will get your computer's IP by doing:
 - Windows touch + "R"
 - typing "cmd" and pressing "enter"
 - typing "ipconfig" in the console
 - get your ipv4 address 
By default ports are configured even if these seem empty, but you can manage them, just be sure you are using the same ports in you app and Cockpit++.lua
7) Now start a mission, remove the pause, startup your plane and it should work :)
8) Not working? check the previous steps and/or restart the app
9) Still not working? Then go in Not working? in the app, you will have some ideas of possible problems with the solution
Trick: the LUA files must be saved before you launch DCS
Still having trouble to configure the app?
If you are sure you have exactly followed the installation guide and you still have problem to connect the app with the game, here you will find some ideas about possible problems

2) In the Cockpit++.lua, are you sure you didn\'t touch/remove/add any \"—\" characters? They are used add comments in the script, they are not interpreted by the computer. You can manipulate them if you have some programming knowledges
3) Are you sure your computer where DCS is running is on the same network than your Android?
4) Maybe you have a blocking antiVirus/firewall?
5) Maybe your refused some permission on your Android for this app?
6) Did you activate your wifi/wireless on your Android?

7) If you have doubts about your Cockpit.lua configuration because default Notepad in your Windows isn\'t clear enough for you, I suggest you to use Notepad++ instead of the basic Notepad,then the script will be easier to read, and you will see difference between the executed code and the commented lines (for explanations)
8) If the app shows the data from the game but you can\'t send actions to DCS, it means you made a mistake in the Android app
9) If you can send actions to DCS but the app doesn\'t show the data on the panel in the app , it means you made a mistake in the Cockpit++.lua
10) Be sure you are not in the menu, the connection will work only if you are in running game (with no pause)

11) When you download and extract the files, be sure about their type. Windows could hide the type of the file (the extension .lua), so some people added ".lua" so the name of the files and had \'Cockpit++.lua.lua\' instead of \'Cockpit++.lua\' (same with the Export.lua)
12) Join us on our Discord server to help you to install the application:
Cockpit++ is an application for DCS (Digital Combat Simulator), if you don\'t own the game with proper modules this application is useless for you, sorry bro!

I would like to thank everybody who helped me for this app:
- friends
- ED's community ( forums.eagle.ru )
- CheckSix's community ( checksix-forums.com )
- Hoggit's community ( www.reddit.com/r/hoggit/ )
- Razbam
Font are from http://www.dafont.com/fr/digital-display-tfb.font and from http://www.dafont.com/fr/hemi-head.font
Special thanks to Huertix, his app for the A-10C Warthog motivated me to developp Cockpit++, here is his app https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.dev.huertix.throttle_dcs_beta
Also special thanks to contributors of this project:\n- ArthurDCS for the VVI,the HSI and the EMIs for the A-10C \n- **Your nickname if you contribute :D**

Do you want to take part of the project? (translation?new panel?new plateform?… ?) Feel free to contribute here https://github.com/CockpitPP/ (A tuto/doc is in the wiki) or come talk with us on our Discord server:

05–29–2017:
• PCA for Mirage 2000C by Razbam
• PPA for Mirage 2000C by Razbam
• RWR for F-15C by ED

09–14–2017:
• INS for Mirage 2000C by Razbam
• INS Knobs for Mirage 2000C by Razbam
• Armament Panel for the Huey by BelSimTek

11–16–2017:
• Better stability for Android 7 users
• Fix bug of freeze after ejection
• User can't anymore enter text in ports
• Added explanations in the installation guide

12–15–2017:
• Nozzle for AV-8B n/a Harrier by Razbam
• Tablet mod to have several panels
• The application is now open-sourced! (documentation will come soon)
• Discord server opened for anyone

06–10–2018:
• VVI for the A-10C by Eagle Dynamics
• HSI for the A-10C by Eagle Dynamics
• EMIs for the A-10C by Eagle Dynamics
• Radar management panel for the Mig-21Bis by Leatherneck Simulations
• The application has now a documentation to learn how to make a panel
• App is now in fullscreen mod

15–11–2020:
• Fix bug on MIRAGE 2000C by Razbam
• PUI800 for Ka-50 by Eagle Dynamics
• Overhead for Ka-50 by Eagle Dynamics
• UV26 for Ka-50 by Eagle Dynamics
• PRTz for Ka-50 by Eagle Dynamics
• LWR for Ka-50 by Eagle Dynamics

- Do you plan to do more panels and/or more modules?\nI want it! Even if the app was initially done only for the PCA and the PPA of the Mirage 2000C, I made the app to work with other panels/modules, I will probably do other panels (not only for the Mirage 2000C), I also have to own other modules
- I noticed tha app drains the battery, is it normal?\nYes, the app is communicating a lot with the computer using UDP protocol, it needs energy

- Any iOS plans?\nFrom me, no, not for now, for one main reason: I would have to buy a mac, an ipad and Apple dev\' licence. But my code will be shared, we can imagine the .LUA code can be used by someone who wants to develop the iOS version ;)
- Can I use several devices?\nYes, just set properly the .lua file with Androids IP
- How it works?\nDCS provides lua access to interact with the game, so I made a lua file to communicate by UDP with android devices using the wifi

- I want to contribute and make a panel (or translate app in my language, or do test, or contribute as you want), how can I do?\nCome on the project\'s GitHub and contribute: https://github.com/CockpitPP/ or come talk with us on our Discord server:
- My app is not working, what can I do?\nRefer to the \"Guide\" on the menu, properly check every steps and if the problems are still here, check the page \"Not working?\" on the menu
- I found a bug, what can I do to report it?\n Open a ticket on GitHub, or tell us on our Discord ;)
This screen is for developers or anyone who wants to send a command to DCS.

For example, if you want to change jettison cover position in the Mirage 2000, you have to send:
- code to interact = 3248
- device in the cockpit = 6
- type of button = 1
- value = 1 or 0
The inputs must be not null
Please, connect to your wifi first
